rows.title: Pause to respond

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes. 

Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? 

Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly 5 times. 

Then try responding in a calmer way.

Millions of parents say this helps ‚Äì A LOT.

text_1.eng: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today‚Äôs topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you ‚Äì and your family.

media_title.eng: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today‚Äôs topic is about managing stress.

We know how stressful it is to bring up teenagers in these times. Learning to manage your stress helps you ‚Äì and your family.
rows.media_title: Can managing stress help you and your family? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone.

Today's topic is managing stress.

It is important to know how to manage our stress. At times our children can behave in ways that make us feel stressed and us as parents can make our children feel stressed too.

So, it is important to notice when we feel stressed and take a pause and breathe. That will help you manage your stress.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
A few simple habits (like pausing, breathing, and talking calmly) can make your day feel lighter.

When you are calm, your family also feels calmer.

media_title.eng: Pause, take a breath. Now hear how taking a simple pause helped @data.characters.media_female_4.name and her teens

media_transcript.eng:
Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

rows.text_1_facilitator:

When you are calm, your family also feels calmer.

Life is tough sometimes. Before I joined @global.app_name, I used to be grumpy at all times. I would take out my anger on everyone at home, not only my teens but even my husband as well. They would run away when I came home because they knew I would start yelling at them.

Learning to take a pause and breathe was difficult at first. But every time I tried it, it helped me to calm down. Now my teens are no longer running away when I come home and they actually listen better than when I used to shout at them!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let‚Äôs look at an example of how stress can sometimes just get too much, for all of us:

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.name lost his job. He was sitting at home feeling frustrated and stressed when @data.characters.f1_son_18.name entered the room.

character_1_text.eng: Can I have money to buy some airtime?

character_2_text.eng: Leave me alone and mind your own business!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let‚Äôs go back in time and see what might happen if @data.characters.f1_father.name tries something different.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.name realised that his behaviour affected everyone‚Äôs mood and responses. Let‚Äôs see what he does to make things better.

character_1_text.eng:
@data.characters.f1_son_18.name, @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name, I am sorry for getting angry. Since losing my job, I feel very stressed and tired from looking for work every day. 

I know this is also hard for you. How are you feeling?

character_2_text.eng: I feel worried when I need to ask for anything. The answer is always no...

character_3_text.eng: I also feel worried. I want to help, but I don‚Äôt know how.

I know this is also hard for you. How are you feeling?
rows.character_2_text: I feel worried when I need to ask for anything. The answer is always no...
rows.character_3_text: I also feel worried. I want to help, but I don‚Äôt know how.

character_1_text.eng: You two are amazing. You've been carrying so much burden. We want to provide everything you need, but things like airtime and private tutoring cost a lot of money.

rows.character_1_text: You two are amazing. You've been carrying so much burden. We want to provide everything you need, but things like airtime and private tutoring cost a lot of money.

character_1_text.eng: I have an idea! @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name is really good at maths. Maybe she can help @data.characters.f1_daughter_13.name with homework so we don‚Äôt need a tutor?

character_2_text.eng: Yes! I like learning with her!

character_3_text.eng: That‚Äôs a wonderful idea. Thank you both for thinking of a solution together. I am really proud of you.

rows.character_3_text: That‚Äôs a wonderful idea. Thank you both for thinking of a solution together. I am really proud of you.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We learned a lot from @data.characters.f1_father.name about making things better, even after getting angry.

Now, let‚Äôs think about your own life. What helps you feel calm in a stressful moment?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Great idea!

Pausing in your own way doesn‚Äôt make the situation easier, but it helps you feel less overwhelmed and more in control.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!

section_1_text.eng:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.

section_2_text.eng:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.

section_3_text.eng:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.

section_4_text.eng:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are a few skills to help you manage stress that you can use with your teens!
rows.section_1_text:
Breathe slowly. Pause.

Before you say anything, slowly breathe in and out five times. It will calm you, and give you a chance to think.
rows.section_2_text:
Share how you feel.

This is hard. Many of us were told not to cry, or show our feelings to our children. But take a deep breath and calmly tell them how you feel. They will understand better, and also learn from you how to deal with stress.
rows.section_3_text:
Show them you care.

This is also hard! Stress makes us focus on ourselves. But our teens need our support. Ask them how they feel. Listen to them and comfort them. Try a hug or say "I understand". It can change everything.
rows.section_4_text:
Seek the positive.

Can you and your teen think about ideas that might help? Can you do something positive together to take your mind off the stress?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
This week's home activity is to respond calmly when you feel stressed.

Whenever you feel stressed or upset with your teen, pause and take five slow breaths before you react. When you are both calm, share how you feel with each other.

text_2.eng:
**Remember to:** 

üòÆ‚Äçüí® BREATHE: take five breaths in and out before you react
ü§ùüèæ SHARE: when you're both calm, share with your teen how you feel
üíô SHOW: ask them how they feel to show you care
üîç SEEK: find something positive in this situation together

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you try taking five slow breaths before responding this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! Pausing to breathe before reacting will help your whole family feel calmer.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That‚Äôs a good start. When you are stressed, remember to take a few deep breaths, it will make it easier to respond calmly.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: I understand, sometimes we just don‚Äôt have capacity. Try to keep spending time with your teen - whenever you are ready you can practise responding calmly and find a Safety Word together.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Great! Pausing to breathe before reacting will help your whole family feel calmer.

**Remember to:** 

üòÆ‚Äçüí® BREATHE: take five breaths in and out before you react

text_1_facilitator.eng: Remember, when we practice responding calmly and sharing how we feel, our teens learn to do the same. This skill will help them their whole life!

media_title.eng: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father

media_transcript.eng:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Remember, when we practice responding calmly and sharing how we feel, our teens learn to do the same. This skill will help them their whole life!
rows.media_title: Hear how @data.characters.media_son_1.name learned to stay calm from his father
rows.media_transcript:
Whenever I would do something wrong, my father would get so angry at me and beat me. He would not even listen to me and I would get so angry as well at him and everyone else.

Now, when he gets angry, he first takes a few deep breaths before he responds. It makes everyone calm down instead of causing a big fight.

It really helped me at home and at school, because even me I am no longer slashing everyone and I am no longer this moody person. When I feel really angry or stressed, I also take deep breaths like my father does. I am a different person.
